alert.note: Alert for Kingman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 08 at 6:41AM CDT until July 09 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kansas... Ninnescah South Fork near Murdock affecting Kingman County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ninnescah South Fork near Murdock. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor overflow occurs along both banks. However, on the south side of the banks near the river bridge on SE 160th Avenue, flooding spreads out into pastureland to the extent of 1000ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Ninnescah South Fork Murdock 8.0 8.6 Sat 6 am CDT 5.8 4.9 4.5 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM CDT.
